heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 09 November 2025, dropping 47.89mm of rain over the 144.8 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 34.3mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (195°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: A significant windy period is on-going and is ranked 5th for length since 23 September 2024.  So far, it has lasted 4 consecutive days beginning 02 February 2026.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%) and rainfall (up 1.6 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 356 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 130 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 356.3m lower than yesterday, 124.3m lower than the past week, 129.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 530m and a high of 1993m, averaging 654.5m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Some rain can be expected, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
